name: Jack Fruit
description: Maple leaves are palmate, lobed leaves commonly found in temperate regions. They are known for their vibrant red, orange, and yellow fall colors.
habitat: Temperate regions, mainly in North America, Europe, and Asia.

name: Paper Mulberry
description: Oak leaves are lobed and can vary in shape, with some species having deeply lobed leaves, while others are more rounded. They are typically thick and leathery.
habitat: Widespread in the Northern Hemisphere, including Europe, North America, and Asia.

name: Cassava
description: Pine needles are long, thin, and evergreen. They grow in clusters and can be found in various lengths depending on the species.
habitat: Widely distributed in temperate and subtropical regions of the Northern Hemisphere.

name: Rain tree
description: Birch leaves are simple, alternate, and ovate with serrated edges. They are typically bright green, turning yellow in autumn.
habitat: Common in cooler regions of the Northern Hemisphere, such as North America, Europe, and Asia.
